intro: Hemizonia anomala, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, pale pink to white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant has a short, woody stem and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine, white powder, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Hemizonia anomala is primarily pollinated by insects and is considered a valuable species for botanical research due to its unusual appearance and ecological significance.
